de.mrapp.android.adapter.list

Interface ListAdapter<DataType>

  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - The type of the adapter's underlying data
    All Superinterfaces:
    android.widget.Adapter, java.lang.Cloneable, DataStructure, EnableStateListAdapter<DataType>, FilterableListAdapter<DataType>, ItemStateListAdapter<DataType>, android.widget.ListAdapter, Loggable, Parameterizable, RecyclerViewAdapter, Restorable, java.io.Serializable, SortableListAdapter<DataType>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MultipleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>, NoChoiceListAdapter<DataType>, SelectableListAdapter<DataType>, SingleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSelectableListAdapter, MultipleChoiceListAdapterImplementation, NoChoiceListAdapterImplementation, SingleChoiceListAdapterImplementation

    public interface ListAdapter<DataType>
extends RecyclerViewAdapter, android.widget.ListAdapter, EnableStateListAdapter<DataType>, ItemStateListAdapter<DataType>, SortableListAdapter<DataType>, FilterableListAdapter<DataType>
    Defines the interface, an adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary items, must implement. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a AbsListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface android.widget.Adapter

        IGNORE_ITEM_VIEW_TYPE, NO_SELECTION

      • addItem

        int addItem(@NonNull
            DataType item)
        Adds a specific item to the adapter. The item will be added at the end.
        Parameters:
        item - The item, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null
        Returns:
        The index of the the item, which has been added to the adapter, as an Integer value or -1, if the item has not been added

      • addItem

        boolean addItem(int index,
                @NonNull
                DataType item)
        Adds a specific item to the adapter. The item will be added at a specific index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index, the item should be added at, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        item - The item, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null
        Returns:
        True, if the item has been added to the adapter, false otherwise

      • addAllItems

        boolean addAllItems(@NonNull
                    java.util.Collection<? extends DataType> items)
        Adds all items, which are contained by a specific collection, to the adapter. The items will be added in a consecutive order at the end.
        Parameters:
        items - The collection, which contains the items, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no items should be added
        Returns:
        True, if all items have been added to the adapter, false otherwise

      • listIterator

        java.util.ListIterator<DataType> listIterator(int index)
        Returns a list iterator, which allows to iterate the adapter's items, starting at a specific index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index, the iterator should start at, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        A list iterator, which allows to iterate the adapter's items, starting at the given index, as an instance of the type ListIterator. The iterator may not be null

      • subList

        java.util.List<DataType> subList(int start,
                                 int end)
        Returns a list, which contains the adapter's items between a specific start and end index.
        Parameters:
        start - The start index of the items, which should be returned, as an Integer value. The item, which belongs to the start index will be included. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        end - The end index of the items, which should be returned, as an Integer value. The item, which belongs to the end index, will be excluded. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int -1 and it must be greater than the start index, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        A list, which contains the adapter's items, between a specific start end end index, as an instance of the type List or an empty list, if the adapter does not contain any items

      • toArray

        java.lang.Object[] toArray()
        Returns an array, which contains the adapter's items.
        Returns:
        An array, which contains the adapter's items, as an Object array or an empty array, if the adapter does not contain any items

      • toArray

        <T> T[] toArray(@NonNull
                T[] array)
        Returns an array, which contains all of the adapter's items. If the given array is large enough to hold the items, the specified array is used, otherwise an array of the same type is created. If the given array can hold more items, the array's elements, following the adapter's items, are set to null.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the array, which should be returned
        Parameters:
        array - The array, which should be used, if it is large enough, as an array of the generic type T. The array may not be null
        Returns:
        An array, which contains all of the adapter's items, as an array of the generic type T or an empty array, if the adapter does not contain any items
